tn.ref: The declaration of the word of Yahweh to Israel by the hand of Malachi
tn.text: This can be expressed as a statement. "This is the declaration of the word of Yahweh to Israel by the hand of Malachi"
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
Here "hand" stands for acting or doing. AT: "through the action of Malachi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This question indicates that the people doubt the truth of what God says. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "You have not shown that you love us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

This question, a reply of Yahweh reminding the people of their nation's history, may also be expressed as a statement. AT: "You know that Esau was Jacob's brother." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"Yahweh has solemnly said this"

Here "loved" implies a relationship of loyalty between Yahweh and Jacob, in which a covenant existed between them. This can be made explicit. AT: "as you know, I obligated myself with a covenant to love Jacob" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This name "Jacob" refers here not only to Jacob, but also to all his descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hated" implies that there was no covenant between Yahweh and Esau. However, it does not imply that Yahweh was emotionally against Esau.
This name "Esau" refers here not only to Esau, but also to all his descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to the hill country of Edom.

tn.ref: and I have made his inheritance a place for the jackals of the wilderness
tn.text: In the Old Testament, the presence of wild animals such as jackals was a frequent description of land deserted by the people who once lived there.
Here "inheritance" stands for the region that Esau's descendants, the nation of Edom, occupied. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "Edom" stands for the people of Edom. AT: "If the people of Edom say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "throw down" stands for "destroy." AT: "I will destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "wickedness" stands either for wicked people or for wicked actions. AT: "country of wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Your own eyes will see this
tn.text: Here "your own eyes" stands for the people themselves. AT: "You yourselves will see this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Yahweh rebukes the priests using an imaginary conversation in which the priests protest that they are doing right and Yahweh tells them what they are doing wrong.
Here "my name" stands for Yahweh himself. AT: "treat me as though you hate me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: How have we despised your name?
tn.text: Here the priests are asking a question in order to state that they have not really despised Yahweh. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "We have not really despised your name." or "Tell us how we have despised your name, because we do not think that we have done so." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here "polluted" describes anything that is not suitable to sacrifice to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here the priests are asking a question in order to state that they have not really polluted Yahweh. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "We have not polluted you." or "Tell us how we have polluted you, because we do not think that we have done so." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This expression refers to insulting God by giving him unsuitable sacrifices. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to an altar.

tn.ref: By saying that Yahweh's table is contemptible
tn.text: This is the answer that Yahweh gives to the priests, but the full answer is only implied. This can be made explicit. AT: "You have polluted me by saying, 'Yahweh's table is contemptible.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
regarded as worthless

tn.ref: When you offer blind animals for sacrifice, is that not evil?
tn.text: Here Yahweh is asking a question in order to make a statement. This sentence functions as a rebuke to the people. AT: "You know very well that it is evil for you to offer blind animals for sacrifice!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: When you offer the lame and sick, is that not evil?
tn.text: Here Yahweh is asking a question in order to make a statement. AT: "And you know very well that it is evil for you to offer the lame and sick!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here Yahweh gives a command in order to express a conditional idea. AT: "If you present that to your governor," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_imperative]])

tn.ref: Will he accept you or will he lift up your face?
tn.text: Here Yahweh is asks this question in order to rebuke the people. AT: "If you do those things, you know that the governor will not accept you. He will not lift up your face." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: will he lift up your face
tn.text: Lifting up someone's face refers to accepting him with favor. AT: "will he accept you with favor" or "will he agree to help you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
give as a gift to show respect

tn.ref: Now you keep asking the face of God, that he may be gracious to us
tn.text: Malachi is no longer speaking for God. He is talking directly to the Israelites; he is criticizing them for daring to think that God will have mercy on them.

tn.ref: keep asking the face of God
tn.text: Here "face" stands for God and also for his presence. AT: "keep asking God in his presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: with such an offering in your hand, would he lift up any of your faces?
tn.text: Here Yahweh is asking a question in order to make a statement of rebuke. AT: "if you offer unacceptable offerings, God will certainly not lift up your faces." (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: with such an offering in your hand
tn.text: This difficult phrase in Hebrew is interpreted in many different ways by modern versions.
Here "hand" stands for the people bringing the offering. AT: "brought by you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This expresses great desire.

tn.ref: so that you might not light fires on my altar in vain
tn.text: Here "light fires on my altar" stands for offering sacrifices on Yahweh's altar. AT: "so that you might not make fires to burn offerings that I will not accept" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "your hand" stands for "you." AT: "from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: from the rising of the sun to its setting
tn.text: This double expression means "everywhere." It is parallel to "among the nations" and "in every place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: my name will be great among the nations
tn.text: Here "my name" stands for "I." AT: "I will be honored in other nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "name" stands for "reputation," "honor." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: in every place incense and pure offerings will be offered in my name
tn.text: This may be expressed in active form. AT: "in these nations people will offer incense and pure offerings to me in order to worship me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "name" stands for Yahweh. AT: "to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Possible meanings are 1) "the meat sacrificed on the altar from animals whose other parts the priests should eat" or 2) "the meat sacrificed on the altar."
show great disrespect by making noises through the nose (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Should I accept this from your hand?
tn.text: Here Yahweh is asking a question in order to make a statement of rebuke. AT: "I should certainly not accept this from you!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here "your hand" stands for "you." AT: "from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: my name will be honored among the nations
tn.text: This may be expressed in active form. AT: "people in the other nations honor my name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "my name" stands for Yahweh. AT: "I will be honored" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
